Title: Trend prediction for computer science research topics using extreme learning machine
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya 27, Kebon Jeruk Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sari, N., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya 27, Kebon Jeruk Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia; Suharjito, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya 27, Kebon Jeruk Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia; Widodo, A., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya 27, Kebon Jeruk Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: Computer sciences have substantial contribute in various human activities. It makes research on computer science domain become more and more interesting to be done. Pure and applied research conducted to develop and enrich the knowledge of computer science. Interest of researchers in conducting research in the field of computer science led to a need to know the trend of computer science research topics in the future. Therefore, it is necessary to predict trends to know what are the research topics related to computer science. The extreme learning machine (ELM) is a new artificial neural network method. ELM learning methods designed to overcome the weaknesses of feedforward neural networks, especially in terms of learning speed. This method has the advantage of producing a good generalization performance. This study implements ELM to predict trends in computer science research topics and to analyze the accuracy in predicting the ELM. The results of this study showed that prediction research topics using ELM has a high accuracy with average precision 0.7782 for up rend topics prediction and 0.8954 for down trend topics prediction. The best numbers of input used for prediction in this study are 6 units. ELM performance in terms of speed is better than the performance of linear prediction and backpropagation. ELM performance in terms of testing accuracy is better than the performance of linear prediction and backpropagation. Predicted results using the ELM shows that in 2013 the uptrend topics are: "Intelligent Web Services and Semantic Web", "Ubiquitous Computing", and "Web Search". © 2012 Elsevier B.V.
Author Keywords: Computer science; Extreme learning machine; Prediction; Trend
